Title: We thought the fact that he spoke Arabic would be an advantage f...
Description: Hadassah Lazar believed that her brother Shlomo Mantzur, the oldest of the hostages, would survive. When news came that he'd been murdered on Oct. 7, the family tore their shirts as is customary in Jewish tradition – then set them aside until his body is returned

Title: Israeli settlers attack Palestinians and IDF soldiers in West Ban...

Title: Arab states must find an alternative to Trump's plan if they wish...
Description: The UAE's U.S. ambassador said there's no alternative to Trump's plan, supposedly showing support for the mass displacement of Palestinians. But the Emirati stance actually emphasized the urgency in which the Arab states must draw up a rival proposal

Title: Arab states must find an alternative to Trump's Gaza plan if they...
Description: The UAE's U.S. ambassador said there's no alternative to Trump's plan, supposedly showing support for the mass displacement of Palestinians. But the Emirati stance actually emphasized the urgency in which the Arab states must draw up a rival proposal

Title: This book will haunt us': The first English language opera about...
Description: State of the Jews,' a new opera by composer Alex Weiser and librettist Ben Kaplan, explores the profound dissonance at the center of Theodor Herzl's character along with his tragic family life. 'Herzl's story is unfinished history – it's still unfolding,' says Weiser

Title: Keith waited for us. Day after day, hour after hour, for 484 day...
Description: The nephew of released hostage Keith Siegel, Asaf Feldman, said statements of Israeli MKs opposing the deal 'really brought him down', and that it was the protests for the hostages that encouraged him. 'We know now it had reached him,' Feldman said

Title: Israel's finance minister says he hopes plan to relocate Gazans c...
Description: Asked about Trump's proposal, Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich claimed that most Gazans would want to relocate, adding that they 'have nothing to seek' there over the next 10-15 years

Title: A dangerous message': Hostage family members beg Conference of P...
Description: Hundreds of American Jews and Israelis – among them families of hostages and victims of October 7 – say in their letter that far-right minister had opposed the release of their loved ones. Despite the outcry, the organization said it 'looks forward' to hearing from Chikli

Title: Trump's ultimatum fizzled out, but Netanyahu could still block Ga...

Title: These activists cried together over the release of a hostage they...
Description: The dozens who gathered in Kfar Sava to watch Iair Horn's release met during protests for the Horn brothers' release. Ever since, they have been living embodiments of solidarity, demonstrating every week and taking turns cooking food for his mother. 'It's a moment of victory, but it's not over'

Title: Israel works to speed up first-stage hostage release amid Hamas c...
Description: Despite Saturday's release going as planned – and even though Israel backtracked on its demand to free all the hostages by then – Israeli talking points still aren't sending a 'business as usual' message: implicit threats to resume the war continue to mount

Title: Study: Amount of food entering Gaza met international aid standar...
Description: Israeli researchers found that the food entering Gaza provided an average of 3,000 calories per person per day. In February 2024, during the fierce fighting in Gaza and attempts by Israeli activists to block aid trucks from entering Gaza, only 1,508 calories per person per day was delivered

Title: A family restored, children hugging their father – that's the re...
Description: For a year, Ofer Kalderon's cousin Eyal, has been running around the Knesset, speaking at committees and meeting MKs. After 484 days, Ofer was reunited with his family, but the struggle is not over for Eyal. 'I think that no Israeli, no Jew, can sit quietly knowing that it could be any one of us'

Title: This journalist used to joke about being spied on. Then Israeli s...
Description: Italian journalist Francesco Cancellato wrote investigative pieces on Italy's ruling party's ties to far-right and neo-fascist movements. After his phone was hacked using an Israeli software, he says he is worried for democracy both in Italy and abroad – but still believes in the need for spyware

Title: Yeshiva students in Mitzpe Ramon threaten, push and brandish knif...
Description: The man had been contracted to clear dirt from the site of a local yeshiva, was physically confronted by students who said 'This is our dirt,' slashing his car tires. The local council head said the matter was 'complicated' and is under review

Title: Israel reportedly planning attack on Iranian nuclear site, seekin...

Title: Released from detention, owners of East Jerusalem bookstore still...
Description: Ahmed and Mahmoud Muna were held in detention for two nights in harsh condition, after police raided their bookshop and confiscated books they claimed 'incited violence.' The brothers were questioned just once – for 15 minutes. 'We challenge the Israeli narrative, but also the Palestinian narrative,' Mahmoud told Haaretz

Title: Trump injects poisonous concept of ethnic cleansing into already ...

Title: Israeli government opposes revealing Gaza deal details, citing se...
Description: Israel's government responded to a petition to reveal the deals details, telling the High Court it should be 'dismissed' due to national security risks. Petitioners argued that disclosing the details would not harm security, as Hamas is fully aware of the deal's components

Title: Freed hostages confirm signs of life from those Israel estimates ...
Description: Some signs confirm hostages were alive until release, while others were alive during specific periods. Freed hostages are debriefed on the same day of their release if possible. Most were held by senior Hamas figures, with some operatives considering Haniyeh's assassination more significant than Sinwar's killing

Title: 76 hostages in limbo: Unleashing hell on Gaza won't save them
Description: A sign of life is a call to action. There are still people who can be saved: We just have to make sure it happens – and fast

Title: Israel gambles with hostage release as Netanyahu delays negotiati...
Description: As part of the deal, the two sides are set for 35 days of indirect talks, but Netanyahu has delayed progress. He is also using Trump's volatile comments to pressure Hamas, a risky move that may backfire

Title: Lebanon denies report of agreeing to Israel's delayed withdrawal ...
Description: A Lebanese source and diplomat told Reuters that Israel sought to delay its withdrawal from five southern positions until February 28, but Lebanese officials rejected the request, insisting on a full withdrawal by February 18

Title: Netanyahu claims 'political persecution' in bribery trial, saying...
Description: Prime Minister Netanyahu's defense argues that, despite allegations of granting regulatory benefits to Walla's owner for favorable coverage, the site's reporting on him and his family was actually negative

Title: 2024 was deadliest year on record for journalists, with most deat...
Description: Killings of journalists rose 22 percent from last year, driven by the Israel-Hamas war, which claimed 85 journalists. 'This is the most dangerous time for journalists in modern history,' says the head of the Committee to Protect Journalists (CPJ)

Title: King Abdullah says no: Why Jordan won't be accepting Gazans any t...
Description: King Abdullah II became both the first Arab leader to meet with U.S. President Trump, and the first to directly reject his proposal to relocate Gaza's two million Palestinians to Jordan. Title: There's no way Omri won't come home. His wife and daughters need...
Description: At a hotel in Eilat, Michal Vardi saw the live broadcast of the abduction on October 7 of her neighbor and close friend, Omri Miran, from his home in Kibbutz Nahal Oz. Title: Amid the Gaza uproar, Trump shot down Netanyahu on Iran
Description: The cacophony triggered by his proposal to 'take over' Gaza obscured the fact that U.S. President Donald Trump has, for now, thwarted a key policy pushed by Israel's PM. Title: Speak Arabic': How Israel turned a language into a campaign of r...
Description: In recent years there has been an increasingly bleak, dehumanizing turn to how Israel understands its Arab and Palestinian neighbors, mixing retaliation and religious nationalism, which has accelerated since October 7. From Fauda to IDF graffiti in Gaza, weaponizing Arabic is a core feature of this other war

Title: Amid the Gaza uproar, Trump shot down Netanyahu on Iran
Description: The cacophony triggered by his proposal to 'take over' Gaza obscured the fact that U.S. President Donald Trump has, for now, thwarted a key policy pushed by Israel's PM. For decades, Netanyahu's strategic, and personal, obsession has been Iran – but Trump is in no hurry to approve a military strike

Title: Physically, he's okay. Emotionally, we still don't know. He does...
Description: Eight months after Shlomi Ziv was rescued from Gaza in a military operation, his mother says he is still adjusting to the new reality. 'He is very excited when he sees more hostages being freed. Our hearts won't be whole until they all come back,' she says

Title: Embassy Down': New series on Israeli staff under attack in Cairo...
Description: Hamas' onslaught on October 7 happened while 'Embassy Down,' called 'Tahrir' in Hebrew, was still in production. The series borrows from a real-life attack on the Israeli Embassy in Cairo, but alas the series doesn't perceive Israel's deeds as a factor in shaping reality

Title: Israeli sources believe Netanyahu intends to derail Gaza cease-fi...
Description: According to a source, the delegation is heading to Qatar 'without the ability to do anything.' Another source warns that the PM's conduct could also collapse the current stage of the deal: 'Once Hamas realizes there's no Stage 2, it won't complete the first one either'

Title: Israel Police buys armored boats without official bid from obscur...
Description: Naval warfare experts told Haaretz that the police don't need armored boats, as the navy handles security along Israel's coast. A senior police official said 'officers at sea might find themselves facing terrorists,' but agreed that the police have more urgent priorities

Title: UNRWA still operates in Jerusalem, West Bank and Gaza despite Isr...
Description: Two laws passed by the Knesset came into effect at the end of January, banning UNRWA operations. However, Israel has so far not taken any direct action aimed at preventing UNRWA from operating schools and services

Title: UNRWA still operates in Jerusalem, West Bank, and Gaza despite Is...
Description: Two laws passed by the Knesset came into effect at the end of January, banning UNRWA operations. However, Israel has so far not taken any direct action aimed at preventing UNRWA from operating schools and services

Title: The demon of ethnic cleansing has been let out of the bottle in I...
Description: Trump has normalized the discourse around ethnic cleansing in Gaza, revealing the aspirations of many Jews in Israel. The prime minister and defense minister have turned population transfer into government policy, advancing Kahane's legacy

Title: Trump and Netanyahu are fulfilling a legacy of Jewish supremacy '...
Description: When one examines Netanyahu's actions ever since he formed his narrow right-wing coalition a decade ago, and up to the management of the current war, as the head of a fully-right-wing government, one finds a clear trend indicating the fulfillment of the legacy of Rabbi Meir Kahane who said, 'let them live there in love and fraternity and in coexistence with their brethren, an Arab coexistence, but not here'

Title: In one indulgent Washington weekend, Netanyahu's indifference and...
Description: The prime minister's trip to the U.S. was marked by defiant behavior, culminating in a weekend of indulgence and indifference. He constantly signaled that hostages were not his priority as he continues to deceive and stall. Hope now lies with Witkoff and Adelson

Title: Golden showers in Washington and the absurd grotesqueness of Neta...
Description: Smotrich, Stock, will demand end of negotiations, return to high-intensity warfare. The 'religious' bloc, which for the hostages and their families is the disastrous bloc, will threaten to dismantle the government as if 'Trumpsfer' hadn't been promised to us in Gaza. And they surely won't be the only ones demanding more war. And the hostages still languishing in the tunnels? Let them wait for better days

Title: As Netanyahu stalls the next stage of the hostage deal, Israelis ...

Title: Kibbutz Be'eri prepared a celebration, but then the freed hostage...
Description: Neighbors of Ohad Ben-Ami and Eli Sharabi gathered at the Kibbutz pub to celebrate their return from Hamas captivity, but were struck into silence when they saw them, gaunt and pale. 'It looked like they came from the world of the dead,' said one

Title: Released hostage Or Levy did not know his wife was killed on Octo...
Description: Or and his wife hid in a bomb shelter where 16 people were murdered by Hamas on October 7, before being kidnapped. Eli Sharabi, also released on Saturday, didn't know that his brother, wife and children were killed too

Title: It's over': Israeli Hostages reunite with families after 491 day...
Description: I've never been so excited in my life,' Or Levy's brother said upon their reunion ■ Ohad Ben Ami joked with his family, saying, 'I left in size XXL and came back to you in size M' ■ Eli Sharabi was greeted by his mother and sister after his wife and daughters were killed on October 7, 2023

Title: My brother's story might be the cruelest and most insane script ...
Description: Yossi and Eli Sharabi were close. They lived on Kibbutz Be'eri, their children were friends, and they spent summers together at the pool. Both were kidnapped by Hamas to Gaza, where Yossi was killed. Eli is slated to be released soon – and his surviving brother, Sharon, is tasked with telling him his family has been murdered

Title: Trump's plan to 'save' Gaza means killing the Palestinian nation ...
Description: Trump's ideas could turn out to be terribly clever or terribly dumb. But there's no doubt that they're inconceivably cruel. That cruelty is manifested in the fact that in declaring that the United States will take over Gaza, no one bothered to ask Palestinians at all
